The herbiboar is a creature that players can capture with 80 Hunter and 31 Herblore, granting upwards of 1,950 Hunter experience. It can be caught by first tracking down footsteps left across Fossil Island, until reaching a point where the footsteps enter a burrow. Players can then kick the burrow, causing the herbiboar to appear and get stunned just outside the hole. Players may then use secateurs or magic secateurs to harvest between one and three herbs off the herbiboar's back, before it flees.

Using magic secateurs will allow players to harvest an additional herb, compared to the regular secateurs. This additional herb will provide no additional Herblore experience.

Location[edit | edit source]

Location Levels Members Spawns Map
Mushroom Forest on Fossil IslandN/A9Maplink
  • There are a total of 5 areas where you can start, each indicated by a hunter icon () on the map.

Hunting technique[edit | edit source]

To begin tracking a herbiboar, inspect the rock, mushroom, or log next to the hunter icon () on the minimap. There are a total of 5 spots where you can start. Continue by inspecting seaweed, rocks, muddy patches, and mushrooms around the area to find more tracks until a tunnel containing a herbiboar is revealed. Attack this tunnel and harvest the appearing herbiboar. Additionally, the player has a chance to fail at tracking down the creature. When this occurs, a message will appear in the chatbox, stating: The creature has successfully confused you with its tracks, leading you round in circles. You'll need to start again.

Warning: The herbiboar will disappear if a new track is started before collecting its herbs.

Notes[edit | edit source]

  • Since only the beginning step of tracking a herbiboar requires 80 Hunter, hunter potions and spicy stews can be used to temporarily boost from level 77 or level 75, respectively; however, doing so will grant less experience, as it scales on the base Hunter level of the player.
  • The ring of pursuit's effect cannot be used to track herbiboars.
  • It is advised to bring a herb sack to reduce the amount of banking. Alternatively, the tool leprechaun next to the hardwood tree patches can be used to note them.
  • The Graceful outfit is valuable while hunting herbiboars, due to its stamina regenerating properties while inspecting objects while tracking the herbiboar.
  • Stamina potions will significantly increase the amount of herbiboars that can be caught per hour, since there will be a lot of running at all times.
  • The ring of endurance is very valuable for hunting herbiboars, as it will effectively halve the inventory slots used for stamina potions and reduce run energy drain.

Guaranteed tracks[edit | edit source]

Locations of the inspectable objects in the Herbiboar tracking activity.

There are a few instances in which the player will always find the next part of the track by inspecting the same object every time.

  • A - When this spot is approached from the south, the path will always continue at the smelly mushroom.
  • C - When this spot is approached from the west, the path will always continue at the muddy patch.
  • D - When this spot is approached from the west, the path will always continue at the muddy patch.
  • E - When this spot is approached from the north, the path will always continue at the smelly mushroom.
  • F - When this spot is approached from the east, the path will always continue at the smelly mushroom.
  • G - When this spot is approached from the north, the path will always continue at the smelly mushroom.
  • H - When this spot is approached from the north, the path will always continue at the northeastern seaweed.
  • H - When this spot is approached from the east, the path will always continue at the southwestern seaweed.
  • I - When this spot is approached from the east, the path will always continue at the muddy patch, if this was the first part of the track.
  • I - When this spot is approached from the south, the path will always continue at the muddy patch.
  • I - When this spot is approached from the west, the path will always continue at the smelly mushroom.

Experience and harvesting[edit | edit source]

A player harvests the herbs from a herbiboar.

An inspection of the herbiboar's trail can grant 50 experience and occasionally gives numulite or unidentified fossils. Once the player attacks the tunnel at the end of a trail, a herbiboar appears and Hunter experience is gained depending on the player's Hunter level. After the herbiboar appears, it can be harvested, requiring at least level 31 Herblore.

Experience gained from attacking the tunnel at the end of a trail scales depending on the base Hunter level (without considering boosts) of the player. The base value granted is 1,950 xp at level 80 Hunter, with 30 additional experience gained per Hunter level above 80 until level 94. Strangely, 15 additional experience per Hunter level at level 95. Afterwards, 19 additional experience is gained per level from 95 to 99 Hunter.[1]

Harvesting from the herbiboar earns the player experience, herbs, and a chance to obtain the pet Herbi. The amount of herbs picked is a random number 1‚Äì3, and can be increased to 2‚Äì4 if magic secateurs are equipped. For each herb picked except for the first, 25 Herblore experience is granted.

An average of 59‚Äì66 herbiboars can be caught per hour while using stamina potions. This makes the experience rates at level 80 somewhere in between 115,000‚Äì128,000, only increasing as Hunter level increases. A considerably lower number will be caught per hour if not using stamina potions, due to the amount of running required. A weight of 0 kg or lower is highly recommended, as well as the herb sack. Since fossils weigh a bit, it is recommended to store them occasionally in the storage box by the mycelium pool.

Harvesting the herbiboar[edit | edit source]

The quality of herbs dropped by the herbiboar are determined by the player's Herblore level.[2] Some low-level herbs disappear from the droptable entirely at a certain Herblore level, while other high-level herbs require a certain Herblore level threshold to be included in the droptable. See the table below for ranges [3] Toadflax is the only herb that is not dropped at all. The probability of receiving Ranarr weeds or other high tiered herbs scales with herblore level.[4] Quantity of herbs dropped does not scale with levels. The Farming cape does not yield any benefits for harvesting herbiboar.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
2 September 2021
(update)

If players try to start tracking a new Herbiboar when they're in the middle of tracking one, a toggleable confirmation message will now appear (on by default).

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The harvesting animation will show the player holding secateurs even if none are present in the inventory.
  • The herbiboar greatly resembles the bushpig, a pig species native to South Africa.
  • The name "herbiboar" is possibly a pun on the word "herbivore", meaning an animal which feeds exclusively on plants.

References[edit | edit source]

  2. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 18 November 2018. (Archived from the original on 19 March 2019.) Mod Ash: "It influences what herbs you get, though it'd be rather hard to describe exactly how, even if I had the code here with me to read."
  3. ^ Jagex. Mod Maz's Twitter account. 5 June 2018. (Archived from the original on 28 May 2020.) Mod Maz: "It does not scale on skill level. However you do get more if you wear the enchanted secateurs."
  4. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 17 March 2020. (Archived from the original on 28 May 2020.)

[[File:Herbiboar icon.png|left]]
The '''herbiboar''' is a creature that players can capture with 80 [[Hunter]] and 31 [[Herblore]], granting upwards of 1,950 Hunter [[experience]]. It can be caught by first tracking down footsteps left across [[Fossil Island]], until reaching a point where the footsteps enter a burrow. Players can then kick the burrow, causing the herbiboar to appear and get stunned just outside the hole. Players may then use [[secateurs]] or [[magic secateurs]] to harvest between one and three herbs off the herbiboar's back, before it flees.

Using [[magic secateurs]] will allow players to harvest an additional herb, compared to the regular secateurs. This additional herb will provide no additional [[Herblore]] experience.

*There are a total of 5 areas where you can start, each indicated by a hunter icon ([[File:Hunter icon.png]]) on the map.

{{Map|name=Herbiboar|x=3701|y=3849|height=500|width=500|zoom=2}}

==Hunting technique==
To begin [[tracking]] a herbiboar, inspect the rock, mushroom, or log next to the hunter icon ([[File:Hunter icon.png]]) on the minimap. There are a total of 5 spots where you can start. Continue by inspecting seaweed, rocks, muddy patches, and mushrooms around the area to find more tracks until a tunnel containing a herbiboar is revealed. Attack this tunnel and harvest the appearing herbiboar. Additionally, the player has a chance to fail at tracking down the creature. When this occurs, a message will appear in the chatbox, stating: ''The creature has successfully confused you with its tracks, leading you round in circles. You'll need to start again.''

'''Warning''': The herbiboar will disappear if a new track is started before collecting its herbs.

===Notes===
*Since only the beginning step of tracking a herbiboar requires 80 Hunter, [[hunter potion]]s and [[spicy stew]]s can be used to temporarily [[boost]] from level 77 or level 75, respectively; however, doing so will grant less experience, as it scales on the base Hunter level of the player.
*The [[ring of pursuit]]'s effect '''cannot''' be used to track herbiboars.
*It is advised to bring a [[herb sack]] to reduce the amount of banking. Alternatively, the [[tool leprechaun]] next to the hardwood tree patches can be used to note them.
*The [[Graceful outfit]] is valuable while hunting herbiboars, due to its stamina regenerating properties while inspecting objects while tracking the herbiboar.
*[[Stamina potion]]s will significantly increase the amount of herbiboars that can be caught per hour, since there will be a lot of running at all times.
*The [[ring of endurance]] is very valuable for hunting herbiboars, as it will effectively halve the inventory slots used for stamina potions and reduce run energy drain.

====Guaranteed tracks====
[[File:Herbiboar inspectable objects locations with indicators.png|thumb|300x300px|Locations of the inspectable objects in the Herbiboar tracking activity.]]
There are a few instances in which the player will always find the next part of the track by inspecting the same object every time.
*'''A''' - When this spot is approached from the '''south''', the path will always continue at the '''smelly mushroom'''.
*'''C''' - When this spot is approached from the '''west''', the path will always continue at the '''muddy patch'''.
*'''D''' - When this spot is approached from the '''west''', the path will always continue at the '''muddy patch'''.
*'''E''' - When this spot is approached from the '''north''', the path will always continue at the '''smelly mushroom'''.
*'''F''' - When this spot is approached from the '''east''', the path will always continue at the '''smelly mushroom'''.
*'''G''' - When this spot is approached from the '''north''', the path will always continue at the '''smelly mushroom'''.
*'''H''' - When this spot is approached from the '''north''', the path will always continue at the '''northeastern''' seaweed.
*'''H''' - When this spot is approached from the '''east''', the path will always continue at the '''southwestern''' seaweed.
*'''I''' - When this spot is approached from the '''east''', the path will always continue at the '''muddy patch''', if this was the first part of the track.
*'''I''' - When this spot is approached from the '''south''', the path will always continue at the '''muddy patch'''.
*'''I''' - When this spot is approached from the '''west''', the path will always continue at the '''smelly mushroom'''.

==Experience and harvesting==
[[File:Harvesting herbiboar.gif|thumb|200px|right|A player harvests the herbs from a herbiboar.]]
An inspection of the herbiboar's trail can grant 50 experience and occasionally gives [[numulite]] or [[unidentified fossils]]. Once the player attacks the tunnel at the end of a trail, a herbiboar appears and Hunter experience is gained depending on the player's Hunter level. After the herbiboar appears, it can be harvested, requiring at least level 31 [[Herblore]].

Experience gained from attacking the tunnel at the end of a trail scales depending on the base Hunter level (without considering boosts) of the player. The base value granted is 1,950 xp at level 80 Hunter, with 30 additional experience gained per Hunter level above 80 until level 94. Strangely, 15 additional experience per Hunter level at level 95. Afterwards, 19 additional experience is gained per level from 95 to 99 Hunter.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/966235023061012480|date=21 February 2018|archiveurl=https://archive.is/85MRc|archivedate=28 May 2020|quote=Looking closer, that formula goes up to 95, At 95, it's 2385, then 2404, then 2423, etc. adding 19 per level up to 99. I don't know why.}}

Harvesting from the herbiboar earns the player experience, herbs, and a chance to obtain the pet [[Herbi]]. The amount of herbs picked is a random number 1‚Äì3, and can be increased to 2‚Äì4 if [[magic secateurs]] are equipped. For each herb picked except for the first, 25 [[Herblore]] experience is granted. 

An average of 59‚Äì66 herbiboars can be caught per hour while using [[stamina potion]]s. This makes the experience rates at level 80 somewhere in between 115,000‚Äì128,000, only increasing as Hunter level increases. A considerably lower number will be caught per hour if not using stamina potions, due to the amount of running required. A weight of 0 kg or lower is highly recommended, as well as the [[herb sack]]. Since fossils weigh a bit, it is recommended to store them occasionally in the storage box by the [[mycelium pool]].

===Harvesting the herbiboar===
The quality of herbs dropped by the herbiboar are determined by the player's Herblore level.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1063961725358284803|date=18 November 2018|archiveurl=https://archive.is/XzLbi|archivedate=19 March 2019|quote=It influences what herbs you get, though it'd be rather hard to describe exactly how, even if I had the code here with me to read.}} Some low-level herbs disappear from the droptable entirely at a certain Herblore level, while other high-level herbs require a certain Herblore level threshold to be included in the droptable. See the table below for ranges {{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Maz|url=https://twitter.com/JagexMaz/status/1003909677372071936|date=5 June 2018|archiveurl=https://archive.is/OFLvj|archivedate=28 May 2020|quote=It does not scale on skill level. However you do get more if you wear the enchanted secateurs.}} [[Toadflax]] is the only herb that is not dropped at all. The probability of receiving [[Ranarr]] weeds or other high tiered herbs scales with herblore level.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1239957064236949505|date=17 March 2020|archiveurl=https://archive.is/BQ6iD|archivedate=28 May 2020}} Quantity of herbs dropped does not scale with levels. The [[Farming cape]] does not yield any benefits for harvesting herbiboar.

==Trivia==
* The harvesting animation will show the player holding [[secateurs]] even if none are present in the inventory.
*The herbiboar greatly resembles the [[wikipedia:Bushpig|bushpig]], a pig species native to South Africa.
*The name "herbiboar" is possibly a pun on the word "herbivore", meaning an animal which feeds exclusively on plants.
